reviews.text: My family and I had stayed at this resort numerous of times. The last time we stayed was June 2006. A very elegant hot spring resort located at a hilltop in Beito Area. Every staff member greets the customer in a friendly manner and willing to assist the customers in every way. The rooms are spacious and have stunning views of Beito city. Every room also features a bathroom appointed in Kuang in stone. There is also a hot spring soaking tub in every bathroom. Again, the bathtub is constructed in Kuang in stone. The only complain that I have is that the room needs urgent renovations. All in all, my family and I adore the hotel and is anticipating our next stay!
reviews.title: Charming hot spring resort adjacent to Yang Ming Shan

reviews.text: An elegant resort hotel, based on a Japanese style of hospitality (though not a ryokan as such). A peaceful, but convenient sojourn from the hectic pace of Taipei. Outstanding separate communal (and private) hot spring spa with outdoor covered hot spring, hot and cold plunge pools, sauna, steam room, communal showers (extra charge applies). In the Beitou area of Taipei. Also a fine outdoor patio swimming pool and adjoining snack bar, excellent restaurants, bar. Rooms all feature private stone hot tubs, emphasize the hot. Understated luxury, but luxury nonetheless. One of the more memorable places I've stayed.
reviews.title: Elegant, refined mountain side hot springs resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and I have to say we enjoyed our time here on the whole. The main feature of the hotel is the outdoor hot spring facilities which are excellent although they do get slightly crowded sometimes when groups of non-residents are allowed in and as such the whole thing loses an air of exclusivity which one would have hoped for in the room price.
reviews.title: Good but.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself, although not particuarly big and only a standard double bed is adequate, but the best feature being the deep hot spring bath. My major complaint about the room was the thickness of the walls. One night we were unfortunate enough to have a very loud couple return to their room late at night and proceed to make a lot of noise which unfortunately we were privvy to every detail if you know what I mean.
reviews.title: Exellent hot springs resort within easy reach of Taipei Main Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good for exploring the environs around the edge of Taipei and there is a good shuttle bus service to the MTR. However I would warn against the taxi driver's who even though were waiting outside the hotel did not know where we wanted to go (my partner is Chinese so language was not an issue) even when shown the written address. We later found out that we had been ripped off by this driver as he had driven us half way around Taipei to get to our destination which could have been reached in half the time. Fortunately when we complained to the hotel about it they were good enough to refund most of the excess we had paid. As an aside, taxi driver's having no idea where you are asking them to go was more the rule than the exception during our time in Taipei.
reviews.title: A little too popular

likes.disliked: — Too crowded; restaurants lacking in ambience

reviews.text: In summary, good facilities, good location and travel links, helpful staff, mediocre breakfast, rooms could be improved.
